A grouped data frame.

Source: R/grouped-df.r
grouped_df.Rd

The easiest way to create a grouped data frame is to call the group_by() method on a data frame or tbl: this will take care of capturing the unevaluated expressions for you.

See group_data() for the accessor functions that retrieve various metadata from a grouped_df.

grouped_df(data, vars, drop = FALSE)

is.grouped_df(x)

is_grouped_df(x)

Arguments

data

a tbl or data frame.
vars

A character vector.
drop

When .drop = TRUE, empty groups are dropped.

Contents

dplyr is a part of the tidyverse, an ecosystem of packages designed with common APIs and a shared philosophy. Learn more at tidyverse.org.
